column4: every time i use gedit to see smb.conf file it appers edited conrrectly but when i du a sudo tesparm and see the service definitions
the public folder appers whit other
also i cant see on the swat configuration page the wizard button any ideas
i have to installed my self

theres other samba configuration utilities out now besides swat. You may want to try them. Ive not messed with swat in ages. The swat configs May in fact have swat disabled by default untill you edit them.
i know kde has a samba config tool.. of course theres editing the smb.conf by hand.
also saw that swat just totally rewrote my smb.conf for me..  got rid of all my comments and so forth.
i instgalled it with ------>  sudo apt-get install swat netkit-inetd tcpd
it wouldent WORK untill i isntalled tcpd. :)
also some of the how to's i read say you need to create a root password. (wich is considred a bad idea in ubuntu-land)
http://www.go2linux.org/node/98   was one of the sites i read.
